page.title: 16A CHILD'S DAY IN WORLINGTON
page.content:
{ BY SARAH
I am 9 and live at Glebe Farm. I get up at 6.30 and go outside to feed the pigs and let the calves suck their mums before I have breakfast. After breakfast I go back to work cleaning the yard and going to see the sheep and bullocks. I have dinner then do anything else that needs doing.If it is school,I go to school after breakfast.When my school day ends,I go home and do some farm work while mum and dad milk the cows.Then we all have tea. After tea,I watch T.V. or go outside to help dad, then help mum to get the goslings in. On weekdays, I go to bed about 8.pm. but on Saturdays I go to bed at 9.pm. If it is lambing season,dad gets up at midnight to check the lambs.
